results.p: 4 days ago — The meaning of FOOLISH is having or showing a lack of good sense, judgment, or discretion. How to use foolish in a sentence.

results.t: FOOLISH | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: unwise, stupid, or not showing good judgment: That was a rather foolish thing to do. She was afraid that she would look foolish if she refused.

results.t: FOOLISH definition and meaning | Collins English Dictionary
results.p: foolish in American English · 1. without good sense; silly; unwise · 2. a. ridiculous; absurd. b. abashed; embarrassed · 3. Archaic.
foolish Add to list Share · adjective. devoid of good sense or judgment. “foolish remarks”. “a foolish decision”. synonyms: inadvisable, unadvisable · adjective.
adjective. resulting from or showing a lack of sense; ill-considered: unwise: a foolish action; a foolish speech. Synonyms: thoughtless, imprudent, ...

results.t: FOOLISH Synonyms: 243 Similar and Opposite Words
results.p: Synonyms for FOOLISH: stupid, silly, absurd, mad, crazy, insane, idiotic, irrational; Antonyms of FOOLISH: wise, prudent, sound, sensible, sane, judicious, ...

results.t: Meaning of foolishness in English - Cambridge Dictionary
results.p: the quality of being unwise, stupid, or not showing good judgment: the foolishness of youth She has already apologized for her foolishness.
having or showing a lack of good sense or judgment : stupid, silly. a foolish decision/mistake. He was wearing a foolish grin. She's been taking foolish ...
The adjective foolish implies a lack of common sense or good judgment or, sometimes, a weakness of mind: a foolish decision; The child seems foolish. Fatuous ...
noun lack of wisdom or good judgment; foolish quality: Oh, the foolishness of thinking that wealth brings happiness!
